item.title: Tsuyoku Naritai (I Want to Become Stronger)
item.description: The most important thing is that there should be progress. So long as you keep moving forward you will reach your destination; but if you stop moving you will never reach it. Tsuyoku naritai is Japanese. Tsuyoku is “strong”; naru is “becoming,” and the form naritai is “want to become.” Together it means, “I want to become stronger,” and it expresses a sentiment embodied more intensely in Japanese works than in any Western literature I’ve read.
